inclusion.criterion: Adult patients with inadequate response to >/= 1 non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Chronic back pain with onset < 45 years of age
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) indicating active sacroiliitis or positive human leukocyte antigen-B27 (HLA-B27) blood test in addition to meeting spondyloarthritis clinical criteria
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Negative purified protein derivative (PPD) test and chest x-ray performed at Baseline visit must be negative
inclusion.label: met
met
inclusion.evidence: physical exam: afebrile within the normal blood pressure

exclusion.criterion: Fulfillment of modified New York criteria for ankylosing spondylitis
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: physical exam: afebrile within the normal blood pressure

exclusion.criterion: Significant medical events or conditions that may put patients at risk for participation
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Females who are pregnant or breast-feeding or considering becoming pregnant during the study
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: physical exam: afebrile within the normal blood pressure

exclusion.criterion: History of cancer, except successfully treated skin cancer
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Recent history of drug or alcohol abuse
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: physical exam: afebrile within the normal blood pressure

notes: Patient has severe bone pain, positive history of sickle cell crises since childhood. He also had the same symptoms in past two weeks treated with oxycodone which was not beneficial to his pain.
